ai-iti22:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti22:2.2_0: For ‘Love’ is a term for happiness.
ai-iti22:2.3_0: I recall undergoing for a long time the likable, desirable, and agreeable results of good deeds performed over a long time.
ai-iti22:2.4_0: As a result, for seven eons of the cosmos contracting and expanding I didn’t return to this world again.
ai-iti22:2.5_0: As the eon contracted I went to the realm of streaming radiance.
ai-iti22:2.6_0: As it expanded I was reborn in an empty mansion of Brahmā.
ai-iti22:3.1_0: There he was Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
ai-iti22:3.2_0: He was Sakka, lord of gods, thirty-six times.
ai-iti22:3.3_0: Many hundreds of times he was a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extended to all four sides, he achieved stability in the country, and he possessed the seven treasures.
ai-iti22:4.2_0: ‘Of what deed of mine is this the fruit and result, that I am now so mighty and powerful?’
ai-iti22:4.4_0: ‘It is the fruit and result of three kinds of deeds:
ai-iti22:6.2_0: happy with the three kinds of happiness:
ai-iti22:6.3_0: Kindness for the world is happiness
ai-iti22:7.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
